references.text: <ref>{{cite web | url = https://www.regjeringen.no/no/aktuelt/valgdagen-blir-8.-september-2025/id3037352/ | title = Valgdagen blir 8. september 2025 | website = Government of Norway. | date = 3 May 2024 | access-date = 18 June 2024 | language = nb}}</ref>

sentences.text: On 30 January 2025, the Centre Party (Norway)|Centre Party left the governing coalition over disagreements with the Labour Party (Norway)|Labour Party on energy policy relating to the European Union, resulting in the first one-party government in 25 years. Eight cabinet ministers from the Centre Party were replaced, including Centre Party leader and minister of finance Trygve Slagsvold Vedum, who was succeeded by former Prime Minister Jens Stoltenberg.

references.text: <ref>{{cite news |last=Johannessen Litland |first=Karoline |date=30 January 2025 |title=Avviser at han er svekket som statsminister: – Her står jeg!
